class ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.electrical.ecm_components.Resistor(name: str, resistance: ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.Scalar | ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.LookupTableFunction)[source]¶

Resistor element of Thevenin equivalent circuits.

:param : :type : param name: identifier of the resistor :param : :type : type name: str :param : :type : param resistance: value of the resistance (Ohm) :param : :type : type resistance: float or int or pint.Quantity

Parameters:

  • resistance (Union[ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.Scalar, ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.LookupTableFunction])

property resistance¶
Getter of the R0 value. Depending on the x_names (inputs of the function), we retrieve components attribute
among {SoC, SoH, Temp}.
If R0 is a scalar, we don't need to provide any input.
reset_data()[source]¶
init_component(v=None, r0=None)[source]¶

Initialize R0 component at t=0

get_r0_series(k=None)[source]¶

Getter of the specific value at step K, if specified, otherwise of the entire collection

compute_v(i)[source]¶

Compute the resistor potential V_r0, given in input the electric current I=I_r0 #TODO: we will use ‘k’ when there will be the decay of resistance

compute_i(v_r0)[source]¶

Compute the flowing electric current I_r0=I, given in input the resistor potential V_r0

compute_dv(i, i_, dt)[source]¶

Compute the derivative of (dv_r0/dt) using the backward finite differences approach. We consider (dr0/dt) constant, so we can erase the second term of the derivation by parts.

Inputs: :param i: current at time t :param i_: current at previous sampling time t-dt :param dt: delta of time

update_step_variables(r0, v_r0)[source]¶

Aggiorno le liste delle variabili calcolate

Parallel Resistor-Capacitor (RC) element for Thevenin equivalent circuits.

:param : :type : param resistance: :param : :type : type resistance: :param : :type : param capacity: :param : :type : type capacity:

Parameters:

  • resistance (Union[ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.Scalar, ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.LookupTableFunction])

  • capacity (Union[ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.Scalar, ernestogym.ernesto.energy_storage.battery_models.parameters.LookupTableFunction])

property resistance¶
Getter of the R1 value. Depending on the x_names (inputs of the function), we retrieve components attribute
among {SoC, SoH, Temp}.
If R1 is a scalar, we don't need to provide any input.
property capacity¶
Getter of the C value. Depending on the x_names (inputs of the function), we retrieve components attribute
among {SoC, SoH, Temp}.
If C is a scalar, we don't need to provide any input.

reset_data()[source]¶
init_component(r1=None, c=None, i_c=0, i_r1=0, v_rc=None)[source]¶

Initialize RC component at t=0

compute_v(i_r1)[source]¶

Compute the potential of the RC parallel V_r1=V_c.

Inputs: :param i_r1: current I_r1 flowing through the resistor

compute_i_r1(v_rc)[source]¶

Compute the flowing electric current I_r1, given the voltage of the resistor V_r1. The formula for the computation of I_r1 at step k is:

I_r1[k] = V_r1[k] / R1

Inputs¶

:param v_rc : voltage of resistor R1

compute_i_c(dv_c=None, i=None, i_r1=None)[source]¶

Compute the flowing electric current I_c, given the derivative of the capacitor voltage dV_c, by means of the capacitor characteristic formula: dV_c = I_c / C (with respect to time). In alternative, if available we can use the resistor current I_r1 and the circuit current I. In this case, we use the Kirchhoff’s law at node: I_c = I - I_r1.

Inputs¶

param dv_c: param i: param i_r1:

compute_tau()[source]¶

Compute the

update_step_variables(r1, c, v_rc, i_r1, i_c)[source]¶
